author: jochembrouwer
content:
EthJS passes the state tests here on our `master` branch: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/releases/tag/eip7692%40v2.1.0

We don't pass blockchain tests, but I'm rather sure this will have to do (with most of the cases) with Pectra-updates

author: jochembrouwer
content:
Actually I just found a PR: https://github.com/ethereumjs/ethereumjs-monorepo/pull/3568

We pass blockchain/state tests here ðŸ™‚ https://github.com/ethereumjs/ethereumjs-monorepo/pull/3568#issuecomment-2528744545

author: jochembrouwer
content: We don't pass the blockchain tests most likely because of Pectra updates. But we pass EEST on the PR above.

author: jochembrouwer
content: How should I proceed? Should I await a new EEST release for EOF on top of "new" Prague?

author: pdobacz
content: in order to pass blockchain tests - yes, since the latest EOF EEST release didn't have up-to-date Prague support. Evmone will I think soonbe in a state where we can make such a release.
